definition[0]: if there is an inverse relationship between two amounts, one gets bigger at the same rate as the other gets smaller
example[0]: Clearly, the amount of money people save increases in inverse proportion to the amount they spend.
example[1]: the inverse relationship between prices and interest rates
definition[3]: used for saying that one thing increases at the same rate as another related thing gets smaller
example[2]: Stocks moved in inverse relation to oil prices throughout the day.
